thread.title: Man Utd news: Luke Shaw will not play against St Etienne, confirms Jose Mourinho | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd news: Luke Shaw will not play against St Etienne, confirms Jose Mourinho | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd news: Luke Shaw will not play against St Etienne, confirms Jose Mourinho | Metro News
text:
Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 2:20 pm Luke Shaw has played just once in 2017 (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho has confirmed that Luke Shaw will not feature against St Etienne on Thursday night. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The left-back has made just two United matchday squads in 2017 and has played only 90 minutes since the turn of the new year. 
Mourinho has already confirmed Shaw is fit, but insisted there is not reason to change the current back four that has been playing so well together. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne – Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn – FA Cup (A) – Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne – Europa (A) – Wed 22 Feb Southampton – EFL (N) – Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) – Sun 12 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr 
United welcome St Etienne to Old Trafford this Thursday in the first leg of the Europa League last-16 tie and Mourinho said Shaw will not start the game. 
‘He’s not playing tomorrow because my team is playing well,’ said Mourinho in his press conference. 
‘I’m happy with my back four and I’m going to repeat: Valencia, Bailly, Smalling and Daley Blind.’ Jose Mourinho will keep faith with Antonio Valencia and Daley Blind (Picture: Getty) 
Mourinho issued a second warning to Shaw this week after criticising the defender earlier in the season. 
The United boss urged the out of favour defender to keep working towards a recall to the squad. 
‘He has to work and wait,’ said Mourinho. Shaw has seen hardly any action since returning from injury (Picture: Getty)
